21 In answering remarks by one of our anonymous reviewers in fn. 15, we rejected the idea that parameters need necessarily have non-local implications.

However it is evident that if the parametrization space is universal, we expect that given (45), there will be a whole set of local (lexical) choices involving interactions between discourse-anchored reference, modality and domains of insertion. Thus, to take just an example, Manzini (2008) argues that a split between discourse-anchored clitics in the C domain and event-anchored clitics in the I domain can be found in the modal environment of negation, yielding sequences 1/2P - Neg - N in an Italian (Tuscany) variety like (i).
